result.execSummary:
The defendant Kalan W. Butler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kalan W. Butler not in court.  Kevin Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and appearances.  Scheduled today for probation review hearing at 10:30 a.m. and it's now 10:45 a.m.  Court notes outstanding balance due.  State notes he talked to P&P earlier and DE is currently in absconder status.  Nothing has changed re: balance due.  Based on failure to appear today and no payments being made the State is requesting probation be extended for one year.  Court grants motion to extend probation for 12 months based on nonappearance by DE and failure to pay the outstanding balances.

Defendant Kalan W. Butler in court with attorney Thomas L Steinman.  Sue M Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea ot Count 2 & 3,  Dismiss read in Count 1.    No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.
Count 2 & 3:
18 months Probation, concurrent.
30 days Sauk County Jail, With huber on Count 2, consecutive, Jail to commence on or before June 12, 2014 at  6 p.m.
Undergo any counseling per agent.
AODA & treatment
$211.73 Restitution with 15% Surcharge To: SCSD
$243.00 costs & $200.00 sucharge & $10.00 surcharge & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)
$243.00 costs, paid through probation
Paperwork handed in court.
Return date on May 12, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Kalan W. Butler in court with attorney Thomas L Steinman.  Linda A Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Steinman request 2 week reset.  Bond continues.  Return date scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on April 28, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Kalan W. Butler in court with attorney Thomas L Steinman.  Sue M Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Steinman requests reset.  Bond continued.  Return date scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on April 14, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Return date on March 31, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on March 28, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Kalan W. Butler appeared by video means with Attorney ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Sue M. Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does qualify.    Defendant waives reading of complaint. State request $5,000.00 cash bond w/ conditions.  Defendant has 3 convictions in last 5 years.  Was out on bond.  No warrant history.  Attorney ORourke request signature bond.  Ties to community.  Defendant is employed.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Attorney Steinman will represent.  Time limits waived. $500.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute sobriety.  Return date scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 01:00 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 28, 2014 at 10:30 am.
